bibl.title: Letter from Henry R. Viets to Philip Showalter Hench, February 11, 1941

div1.p: Viets invites Hench to submit a manuscript, on Jesse Lazear's work in Cuba, for publication in the "Bulletin of the Medical Library Association."

div1.head: Letter from Henry R. Viets to Philip Showalter Hench, February 11, 1941
div1.opener:
PUBLICATION COMMITTEE
HENRY R. VIETS, M.D.
Chairman
and Editor of the Bulletin
Boston Medical Library
JAMES F. BALLARD
Business Manager
Boston Medical Library
8 The Fenway, Boston
MISS MILDRED JORDAN
Medical School Library
Emory University, Ga.
MISS FRIDA PLERFEZ
Mayo Clinic Library
Rochester, Minn.
NATHAN VAN PATTEN
Lane Medical Library
Stanford University
San Francisco, Calif.
BULLETIN OF THE
MEDICAL LIBRARY ASSOCIATION
Founded 1902
Office of the Editor
8 THE FENWAY, BOSTON, MASS.
February 11, 1941
Doctor P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Mr. Keys has suggested that you might
have a paper of interest to the readers of
the Bulletin on Dr. Lazear and your experi-
ences in tracking down the site of the camp
in Cuba where he did his work.

If you have a manuscript, which you
think I might be interested in, I should be
pleased to have it sent on. In order to
appear in the June number, the manuscript
should reach me by May 1 of this year.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Henry R. Viets, M. D.
Editor HRV:LaR
